Package io.github.asdfjkl.jchesslib

Class Board

java.lang.Object
io.github.asdfjkl.jchesslib.Board
public class Board extends Object
This class represents a current position including all associated parameters (i.e. whose side it is to move, current en passant file, castling rights etc.) It also implements methods for Move generation.

  • Field Details

    • turn

      public boolean turn
      Stores the current turn. Either White (false) or Black (true)
      See Also:
      • CONSTANTS

    • halfmoveClock

      public int halfmoveClock
      Stores the number of halvmoves since the last capture or pawn move

    • fullmoveNumber

      public int fullmoveNumber
      Stores the absolute move number.

  • Constructor Details

    • Board

      public Board()
      creates a new empty Board

    • Board

      public Board(boolean startingPosition)
      creates a new Board. If startingPosition is true, the board will be set up with pieces in initial position, otherwise the board will be empty
      Parameters:
      startingPosition - set to true for the initial position

    • Board

      public Board(String fen)
      creates a new Board. The board position is set up according to the supplied FEN string
      Parameters:
      fen - string in Forsyth–Edwards Notation

  • Method Details

    • alphaToPos

      public static int alphaToPos(char alpha)
      for a given char of a file 'A', ... 'H' returns the corresponding integer * value 0 ... 7
      Parameters:
      alpha - char of 'A' ... 'H'
      Returns:
      number between 0...7

    • internalToXY

      public static Point internalToXY(int internalCoordinate)
      The board uses an internal 12 x 10 mailbox representation with absolute index coordinates 0 ... 119. This converts an index coordinate from 0 ... 119 to a point (x,y) where x in 0 ... 7 represents the file and y in 0 ... 7 the rank of the internal coordinate
      Parameters:
      internalCoordinate - the internal coordinate of a square
      Returns:
      Point(x,y) of the board square

    • xyToInternal

      public static int xyToInternal(int x, int y)
      Converts an x, y board index to the internal mailbox board index
      Parameters:
      x - 0 ... 7, denoting the file
      y - 0 ... 7, denoting the rank
      Returns:
      internal index of the square referenced by (x,y)

    • resetToStartingPosition

      public void resetToStartingPosition()
      resets the Board to the initial position

    • clear

      public void clear()
      clears the Board (i.e. removes all pieces) the turn is set to "white to move"

    • makeCopy

      public Board makeCopy()
      creates a deep copy of the current Board any modifications of the copy will have no effect on the original one
      Returns:
      copy of the current Board

    • copy

      public void copy(Board b)
      copies the supplied Board into this current instance without creating a new Board. Any future modification of the supplied Board or the current one will have no side-effect on the other one
      Parameters:
      b - the source Board

    • fen

      public String fen()
      creates a string encoding of the current Board in Forsyth–Edwards Notation
      Returns:
      the FEN string

    • apply

      public void apply(Move m)
      applies the supplied Move on the current board. The Board state changes to the Board after the move is executed. This function does not check if the supplied Move is legal in the current position.
      Parameters:
      m - Move to apply

    • undo

      public void undo()
      Undoes the last applied Move and resets the Board to the state prior applying the last Move. Undo is only available once, i.e. a sequence apply() - undo() - apply() - undo() is possible, but apply() - apply() - undo() - undo() will throw an IllegalArgumentException Some other functions, like move generation destroy the ability to undo a move. Always check isUndoAvailable() before calling undo()!

    • pseudoLegalMoves

      public ArrayList<Move> pseudoLegalMoves()
      computes all pseudo-legal moves in the current position *
      Returns:
      ArrayList containing pseudo-legal Moves

    • pseudoLegalMoves

      public ArrayList<Move> pseudoLegalMoves(int internalFromSquare, int internalToSquare, int pieceType, boolean genCastleMoves, boolean color)
      computes a subset of all pseudo-legal moves in the current position. The subset is can be defined by providing source and target squares, the desired piece type, whether castling moves should be considered, and the color (i.e. whether we consider Black's or White's moves)
      Parameters:
      internalFromSquare - internal coordinate denoting source square, or CONSTANTS.ANY_SQUARE
      internalToSquare - internal coordinate denoting target square, or CONSTANTS.ANY_SQUARE
      pieceType - piece type (i.e. King, Queen, Rook, Bishop, Knight, Pawn) or CONSTANTS.ANY_PIECE
      genCastleMoves - true if castling moves shoudl be included
      color - one of CONSTANTS.WHITE or CONSTANTS.BLACK
      Returns:
      ArrayList containing pseudo-legal Moves

    • isPseudoALegal

      public boolean isPseudoALegal(Move m)
      Checks if the supplied pseudo-legal Move is a legal Move in the current position. It does not check if the supplied Move is actually a pseudo-legal Move in the current position
      Parameters:
      m - a pseudo-legal Move in the current position
      Returns:
      true, if the Move is legal, false otherwise

    • isLegal

      public boolean isLegal(Move m)
      Checks if the supplied Move is a legal Move in the current position. This is done by first generating all pseudo-legal Moves, then filtering for all legal Moves, and then finally checking if the supplied Move is contained in the list of legal Moves
      Parameters:
      m - the Move that is about to be checked for legality
      Returns:
      true, if Move is legal, false otherwise

    • isLegalAndPromotes

      public boolean isLegalAndPromotes(Move m)
      Checks if the supplied Move is a legal Move in the current position and if the Move leads to a promotion (i.e. is a pawn Move that reaches the last rank). This will return true even if the promotionPiece is _not_ set in the supplied Move.
      Parameters:
      m - the Move. Only source and target square have to be set
      Returns:
      true, if the Move is legal and leads to a promotion, false otherwise

    • legalMoves

      public ArrayList<Move> legalMoves()
      computes an ArrayList of all legal Moves in the current position by first generating all pseudo-legal Moves and then filtering for legal ones.
      Returns:
      ArrayList containing all legal Moves

    • legaMovesTo

      public ArrayList<Move> legaMovesTo(int internalToSquare, int pieceType)
      computes a subset of all legal Moves in the current position by first generating all pseudo-legal Moves and then filtering for legal ones. The subset can be defined by providing a target square and the desired piece type
      Parameters:
      internalToSquare - the target square (internal coordinates) that all Moves must lead to or CONSTANTS.ANY_SQUARE
      pieceType - limit generated Moves to those of the specific piece type or CONSTANTS.ANY_PIECE
      Returns:
      ArrayList with a subset of all legal Moves

    • legalMovesFrom

      public ArrayList<Move> legalMovesFrom(int internalFromSquare)
      computes a subset of all legal Moves in the current position by first generating all pseudo-legal Moves and then filtering for legal ones. The subset can be defined by providing a source square where the Move must originate in
      Parameters:
      internalFromSquare - the source square (internal coordinates) that all Moves must originate in or CONSTANTS.ANY_SQUARE
      Returns:
      ArrayList with a subset of all legal Moves

    • legalsFromPseudos

      public ArrayList<Move> legalsFromPseudos(ArrayList<Move> pseudos)
      This filters a supplied ArrayList of pseudo legal Moves for legal Moves
      Parameters:
      pseudos - an ArrayList of pseudo legal Moves. These Moves are not verified for pseudo-legality
      Returns:
      those Moves from the input list that are legal

    • isCheckmate

      public boolean isCheckmate()
      Checks if the position is a checkmate.
      Returns:
      true if checkmate, false otherwise

    • isStalemate

      public boolean isStalemate()
      Checks if the current position is a stalemate.
      Returns:
      true for a stalemate, false otherwise

    • isCheck

      public boolean isCheck()
      Checks if the king of the player whose turn it is in check
      Returns:
      true if the king is in check, false otherwise

    • san

      public String san(Move m)
      Creates a Move representation in Short Algebraic Notation
      Parameters:
      m - a Move for which SAN is desired
      Returns:
      String with SAN

    • isPromoting

      public boolean isPromoting(Move m)
      Tests if a Move promotes by testing the promotionPiece member of the Move
      Parameters:
      m - Move to be considered
      Returns:
      true if Move promotes, false otherwise

    • isInitialPosition

      public boolean isInitialPosition()
      Checks if the current Board is set up with the initial position Castling rights are considered as well as other parameters such as halfmove clock
      Returns:
      true if has initial position, false otherwise

      Returns:
      true if white can castle short, false otherwise

    • isUndoAvailable

      public boolean isUndoAvailable()
      Checks if Undo is possible for the current Board. Note that at most one undo operation is possible at a time (only undo the last applied move)
      Returns:

    • setPieceAt

      public void setPieceAt(int x, int y, int piece)
      Stores a piece at the provided square. The square location must be provided as x,y (not internal coordinates)
      Parameters:
      x - file (i.e. 0=A ... 7=H)
      y - rank (0=Rank 1, ... 7=Rank 8)
      piece - the piece (of the constants, i.e. CONSTANTS.WHITE_ROOK, CONSTANTS.BLACK_PAWN etc.)

    • getPieceAt

      public int getPieceAt(int x, int y)
      Returns the piece (one of CONSTANTS.WHITE_KING, CONSTANTS.BLACK_ROOK etc.) at the requested square.
      Parameters:
      x - file (i.e. 0=A ... 7=H)
      y - rank (0=Rank 1, ... 7=Rank 8)
      Returns:
      Piece at the given location. Returns CONSTANTS.EMPTY if not piece is present.

    • isPieceAt

      public boolean isPieceAt(int x, int y)
      Tests if a piece is set at the given square, of if the square is empty
      Parameters:
      x - file (i.e. 0=A ... 7=H)
      y - rank (0=Rank 1, ... 7=Rank 8)
      Returns:
      true if a piece is present at the square, false otherwise

    • getPieceAt

      public int getPieceAt(int internalCoordinate)
      Returns the piece at the given square, of if the square is empty
      Parameters:
      internalCoordinate - square location as internal coordinate (i.e. absolute index of the 120 array representation of the Board)
      Returns:
      piece of the requested square, CONSTANTS.EMPTY otherwise

    • getPieceTypeAt

      public int getPieceTypeAt(int x, int y)
      Returns the piece type (regardless of color, i.e. one of CONSTANTS.ROOK, CONSTANTS.KING etc.) of a given square, of if the square is empty
      Parameters:
      x - file (i.e. 0=A ... 7=H)
      y - rank (0=Rank 1, ... 7=Rank 8)
      Returns:
      piece type at the requested square, CONSTANTS.EMPTY otherwise

    • getPieceTypeAt

      public int getPieceTypeAt(int internalCoordinate)
      Return the piece type (regardless of color, i.e. one of CONSTANTS.ROOK, CONSTANTS.KING etc.) at the given square, of if the square is empty
      Parameters:
      internalCoordinate - square location as internal coordinate (i.e. absolute index of the 120 array representation of the Board)
      Returns:
      piece type at the requested square, CONSTANTS.EMPTY otherwise

    • getPieceColorAt

      public boolean getPieceColorAt(int x, int y)
      Get the color of the piece at the given square. Does not check if a piece exists at the square and will return incorrect information for empty square
      Parameters:
      x - file (i.e. 0=A ... 7=H)
      y - rank (0=Rank 1, ... 7=Rank 8)
      Returns:
      one of CONSTANTS.WHITE or CONSTANTS.BLACK

    • getPieceColorAt

      public boolean getPieceColorAt(int internalCoordinate)
      Get the color of the piece at the given square. Does not check if a piece exists at the square and will return incorrect information for empty square
      Parameters:
      internalCoordinate - square location as internal coordinate (i.e. absolute index of the 120 array representation of the Board)
      Returns:
      one of CONSTANTS.WHITE or CONSTANTS.BLACK

    • getKingPos

      public int getKingPos(boolean player)
      Get the location of the king in internal coordinates. The King's color is supplied as a parameter
      Parameters:
      player - one of CONSTANTS.WHITE or CONSTANTS.BLACK
      Returns:
      internal coordinate of the requested king

    • isConsistent

      public boolean isConsistent()
      Computes various characteristics of the current position to check if the position is in a consistent state. Metrics used: Number of pieces does not exceed the theoretical maximum numbers, each player has one king, side not to move is not in check, kings are at least on square apart, castling rights fits to the position of kings and rooks
      Returns:
      true if the board is in a consistent state, false otherwise

    • isBlackKingCastleLost

      public boolean isBlackKingCastleLost()
      Checks if black can still castle short
      Returns:
      true if possible

    • isBlackQueenCastleLost

      public boolean isBlackQueenCastleLost()
      Checks if black can still castle long
      Returns:
      true if possible

    • isWhiteKingCastleLost

      public boolean isWhiteKingCastleLost()
      Checks if white can still castle short
      Returns:
      true if possible

    • isWhiteQueenCastleLost

      public boolean isWhiteQueenCastleLost()
      Checks if white can still castle long
      Returns:
      true if possible

    • getEpTarget

      public int getEpTarget()
      Returns the en passant square (internal coordinates) of the current position.
      Returns:
      ep square, 0 if there is none

    • canClaimFiftyMoves

      public boolean canClaimFiftyMoves()
      Checks 50 moves rule
      Returns:
      true if the side to move can claim a draw according to the 50 moves rule

    • getZobrist

      public long getZobrist()
      Computes the Zobrist hash of the current position
      Returns:
      zobrist hash value

    • getPositionHash

      public long getPositionHash()
      Computes a hash value of the current position. This is similar to a Zobrist hash, but only considers the location of the pieces and their type, i.e. ignores castling possibilities, turn and en passant square. Can be used to quickly search for positions
      Returns:
      hash value of the current position

    • pieceFromSymbol

      public int pieceFromSymbol(char c)
      Computes the piece constant value (one of CONSTANTS.WHITE_KING, CONSTANTS.BLACK_QUEEN) for a given char encoding the pice (i.e. 'k' for black king
      Parameters:
      c - encoding a piece
      Returns:
      int value that is used to represent a piece

    • isKthBitSet

      public boolean isKthBitSet(int n, int k)
      Tests if the k-th bit of a provided int value is set or not
      Parameters:
      n - the int value to check
      k - k-th bit value
      Returns:
      true if set to 1, false if set to 0

    • toString

      public String toString()
      Overrides:
      toString in class Object

    • getPieceType

      public int getPieceType(int piece)
      For given piece (one of CONSTANTS.WHITE_KING, CONSTANTS.BLACK_KNIGHT) returns the piece type (i.e. one of CONSTANTS.KING, CONSTANTS.KNIGHT) removing the color
      Parameters:
      piece - the piece to consider
      Returns:
      the piece type

    • getSquareColorAt

      public int getSquareColorAt(int x, int y)
      For given square in x,y coordinates return the color of the piece that is located at the square
      Parameters:
      x - file (i.e. 0=A ... 7=H)
      y - rank (0=Rank 1, ... 7=Rank 8)
      Returns:
      color value (one of CONSTANTS.IWHITE or CONSTANTS.IBLACK)

    • isInsufficientMaterial

      public boolean isInsufficientMaterial()
      Tests if there is insufficient material to mate and the position is thus drawn
      Returns:
      true if a draw, false otherwise
